title: South Africa's Zuma to go on trial for corruption
text:
Former South African president Jacob Zuma will stand trial on corruption charges related to a $2 billion arms deal.

That's after a high court on Friday (October 11) denied him a permanent stay of prosecution, paving the way for the long-awaited trial to begin in a matter of days.

(SOUNDBITE) (English) JUDGE OF THE HIGH COURT IN PEITERMARITZBURG, JEROME MNGUNI, SAYING:

"The application brought by Jacob Gedleyihlekisa Zuma under case number CCD30/2018 is dismissed with costs. Such costs include those consequent appointments of two counsel".

It is incredibly rare for African leaders to stand trial.

Zuma was in office for close to a decade until his resignation in 2018.

He's facing 18 charges of fraud, racketeering, and money laundering related to a deal to buy European military hardware for South Africa's armed forces in the 1990s.

He denies any wrongdoing and his lawyers have argued he's a victim of a politically motivated witch-hunt.

The trial is expected to start on October 15.
